verbs.description: [ARG1: A bipartisan group of U.S. senators] , [V: led] [ARG0: by Sen. Bob Corker ( R - Tenn . )] , is pursuing legislation that would limit the ability of the U.S. president to broadly use national defense to declare tariffs . Here 's what you need to know about section 232 When President Donald Trump declared that the U.S. would be enacting steep tariffs on imports of steel and aluminum to the United States , he said that he was doing so on national security grounds . The president cited section 232 of the Trade Expansion Act of 1962 , which gives the president the power to determine whether or not an import is threatening national security . The text of this section is broad , and includes “ substantial unemployment … decrease in government revenue … displacement of any domestic products by excessive imports ” as valid threats to national security . “ Steel is steel , ” Trump said in his speech before signing the tariffs on March 8 , “ if you do n’t have steel , …

The text of this section is broad , and includes “ substantial unemployment … decrease in government revenue … displacement of any domestic products by excessive imports ” as valid threats to national security . “ Steel is steel , ” Trump said in his speech before signing the tariffs on March 8 , “ if you do n’t have steel , …
